metadata.title: CVE-2022-34684 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
NVIDIA GPU Display Driver for Linux contains a vulnerability in the kernelmode layer (nvidia.ko), where an off-by-one error may lead to datatampering or information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34684` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnvidia-cfg1-495 - 510.108.03-0ubuntu1
libnvidia-cfg1-510 - 510.108.03-0ubuntu1
libnvidia-common-495 - 510.108.03-0ubuntu1
libnvidia-common-510 - 510.108.03-0ubuntu1

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-430: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

nvidia-graphics-drivers-510 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '510.108.03-0ubuntu1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-515 package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '515.86.01-0ubuntu1').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-515-server package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '515.86.01-0ubuntu2').
